meanings.definition: The distance from the center of a regular polygon to a side.
meanings.sent1: The apothems of the hexagon were all equal in length.
meanings.sent2: To find the area of the polygon, you need to know the length of the apothems.
meanings.sent3: The apothems of the shape were so short, they looked like tiny bridges.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of geometry was the apothems that guided her through the math problems.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful markers to illustrate the concept of apothems on the whiteboard.

meanings.definition: A vertical line segment from the center of a circle to a chord.
meanings.sent1: The apothems of the circle intersected the chord at a right angle.
meanings.sent2: The length of the apothems determines the perpendicular distance to the chord.
meanings.sent3: The apothems of the circle were like the spokes of a wheel, connecting the center to the edge.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as apothems, cutting through the silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The apothems of the circle were like rays of light shining from the center to the edge.
